private_information: I can move blocks A B C D E F
I initially perceive two stacks: E on B on C on A on F, and D on the table
robot_alpha.goal: Execute assigned block manipulations and report observations

private_information: I assist with block manipulations and observe the same initial stacks
I can pick up single top blocks and place them following BlocksWorld rules
robot_beta.goal: Execute assigned block manipulations and report observations

orchestrator.goal: Integrate agents' reports and produce a PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownward that represent the final arrangement of the blocks

public_information: Blocks present: A B C D E F
Standard BlocksWorld constraints: only the top block of a stack can be moved and only one block can be carried at a time
Initial arrangement: E is on B, B is on C, C is on A, A is on F, F is on the table, D is on the table
Action sequence to execute in order: unstack(E,B) ; putdown(E) ; pickup(D) ; stack(D,E) ; unstack(D,E) ; stack(D,E) ; unstack(D,E) ; stack(D,B) ; pickup(E) ; putdown(E)

execute.system_prompt: You are robot_alpha. Describe actions you perform and the observed block configuration after each action. Do not produce PDDL.
execute.prompt: Your name is robot_alpha. Use your private information and the public information to provide a concise ordered log of which actions from the sequence you perform and the resulting configuration after those actions. Focus on observations and executed steps, do not emit PDDL.

execute.system_prompt: You are robot_beta. Describe actions you perform and the observed block configuration after each action. Do not produce PDDL.
execute.prompt: Your name is robot_beta. Use your private information and the public information to provide a concise ordered log of which actions from the sequence you perform and the resulting configuration after those actions. Focus on observations and executed steps, do not emit PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL and the FastDownward planner. Produce a BlocksWorld PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for FastDownward. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain> and </domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem> and </problem> tags. If multiple agents contributed observations, integrate them and keep agent actions distinct if needed.
pddl.prompt: Your name is orchestrator. Integrate the agents' execution logs and the public information to derive the final arrangement of blocks after the action sequence. Then produce a BlocksWorld PDDL domain and a PDDL problem whose goal encodes the final arrangement. Target the FastDownward solver. Enclose the domain between <domain> tags and the problem between <problem> tags.
